arm_group.description: L/S ratio on the gastric aspirates are retrospectively compared with the possible development of RDS
L/S ratio on the hypopharyngeal secretions are retrospectively compared with the possible development of RDS

brief_summary.textblock:
The overall objective is to identify quickly after birth the preterm infants who will
      develop respiratory distress syndrome (RDS) for the purpose of treating them as early as
      possible with surfactant, to reduce, and if possible, to avoid sequelae, including long-term
      oxygen treatment.

      We have therefore developed a quick test, which we believe will be ideal for this type of
      diagnostics, and will now test the method in a preclinical trial.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determination of Lung Maturity and Prediction of RDS at Birth

detailed_description.textblock:
In at least 135 preterm infants with gestational age 24-32 weeks we will collect gastric
      aspirate and hypopharyngeal secretion. The infants are stratified into three groups:
      gestational age 24-25 weeks, 26-29 weeks and 30-31 weeks.

      The aspirates will be frozen at -20 centigrade and lecithin-sphingomyelin ratio (L/S) will
      be analysed retrospectively using Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy.

      The infants will be monitored for the first five days with regard to possible development of
      RDS.

      Clinical and biochemical data will be compared retrospectively.

      There a no intervention procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Preterm infants with gestational ages  of 24 (24+0) to 32 (31+6) weeks.

          -  Age < ½ hour

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Lack of informed consent

          -  lack of aspirate

study_pop.textblock: 135 preterm infants with gestational age 24-32 weeks (24+0 to 31+6)

clinical_study.official_title: Spectroscopic-chemometric Determination of Lecithin-sphingomyelin Ratio in Gastric Aspirates and Secretion From Hypopharynx at Birth, in Relation to Development of RDS

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
